analyzed: legs so // de'i phyir glog thob shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang; khyod la yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
translated: Excellent! Therefore, Vidyuddatta, listen very well and keep it in mind, and I shall explain it to you.

translated: The Blessed One said, “Vidyuddatta,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni gter chen po dang / zad mi shes pa'i gter dang / kun du zad mi shes pa'i gter dang / mtha' med pa'i gter rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa ste /
translated: bodhisattva great beings possess five kinds of great treasures: inexhaustible treasures, inexhaustible universal treasures, limitless treasures,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu'i gter phun sum tshogs par gyur pas /
translated: and, because bodhisattvas have such perfect treasures,

original: rgud pa rnams gtan du spong zhing /
analyzed: rgud pa rnams gtan du spong zhing /
translated: they completely abandon poverty

analyzed: gong du bstan pa lta bu'i yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa yang yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
translated: and perfect the qualities that have been taught.

analyzed: tshegs chung dus myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: With little difficulty, they will quickly attain unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod chags spyod pa'i gter dang / zhe sdang spyod pa'i gter dang / gti mug spyod pa'i gter dang / cha mnyam pa spyod pa'i gter dang / chos thams cad kyi gter gang yin pa'o //🔽glog thob / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @54a *//
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa'i gter dang / zhe sdang spyod pa'i gter dang / gti mug spyod pa'i gter dang / cha mnyam pa spyod pa'i gter dang / chos thams cad kyi gter gang yin pa'o // glog thob / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @54a *//
translated: the treasure of those who practice desire, the treasure of those who practice hatred, the treasure of those who practice delusion, the treasure of those who practice a balance of these, and the treasure of all phenomena.

original: chen po rnams kyi 'dod chags spyod pa'i gter zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: chen po rnams kyi 'dod chags spyod pa'i gter zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: “Vajrapāṇi, what is the treasure of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice desire?”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is as follows:

original: sems can rnams ni 'dod chags kyi spyod pa'i rjes su mthun zhing phyin ci log gis bcings pas /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni 'dod chags kyi spyod pa'i rjes su mthun zhing phyin ci log gis bcings pas /
translated: Sentient beings, who are bound by error, follow the practice of desire.

original: mtshan ma rnams kyi rjes su gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la sogs pa'i yul dag la rnam pa sna tshogs su rnam par brtags na /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams kyi rjes su gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la sogs pa'i yul dag la rnam pa sna tshogs su rnam par brtags na /
translated: When they conceptualize the various aspects of objects such as forms, sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena,

original: brtan pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa dang / bde ba la chags shing myos par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: brtan pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa dang / bde ba la chags shing myos par gyur pa yin la /
translated: they cling to them as being stable and they become attached to and intoxicated by pleasure.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can de dag gi sems kyi spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs gang yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas /🔽sems can de dag gang la mos shing 'dun pa dang / spyod yul gang la chags shing goms pas mthun pa can du gyur pa dang / dad pa ji lta bu dang ldan zhing phun sum tshogs par gyur pa dang / sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta bu bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can de dag gi sems kyi spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs gang yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas / sems can de dag gang la mos shing 'dun pa dang / spyod yul gang la chags shing goms pas mthun pa can du gyur pa dang / dad pa ji lta bu dang ldan zhing phun sum tshogs par gyur pa dang / sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta bu bskyed pa dang /
translated: Bodhisattvas know perfectly well the various kinds of mental behavior of those sentient beings.🔽They know what those sentient beings are interested in and aspire to, what objects they are attached to and accustomed to, what kind of faith they have and what they are endowed with, what kinds of roots of virtue they have previously produced,

original: theg pa gang la gzhol bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed yod pa dag nam zhig na yongs su smin par gyur pa yang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: theg pa gang la gzhol bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed yod pa dag nam zhig na yongs su smin par gyur pa yang rab tu shes te /
translated: what vehicles they are inclined to, and how much of their roots of virtue are ready to come to fruition.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can de dag gi 'dod pa thams cad yongs su spang ba'i phyir dang / de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir shin tu legs par brtags nas yongs su gso bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can de dag gi 'dod pa thams cad yongs su spang ba'i phyir dang / de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir shin tu legs par brtags nas yongs su gso bar byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva, however, having thoroughly examined them, heals them well in order to eliminate all their desires and in order to constantly and uninterruptedly generate the thought of the roots of virtue in them.

original: glog thob / sems can rnams kyi dbang po dang / spyod pa'i bye @54b brag ni shin tu shes par dka' bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: glog thob / sems can rnams kyi dbang po dang / spyod pa'i bye @54b brag ni shin tu shes par dka' bar rig par bya ste /
translated: “O Vidyuddeva, the various faculties and practices of sentient beings should be known to be extremely difficult to understand.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang rig par mi nus na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang rig par mi nus na /
translated: If they cannot be understood even by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: so so'i skye bo dang / mu stegs can rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / mu stegs can rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to speak of ordinary people and tīrthikas?

original: glog thob / sems can kha cig ni 'dod pa rnams la mngon par zhen par gyur kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su smin par byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: glog thob / sems can kha cig ni 'dod pa rnams la mngon par zhen par gyur kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su smin par byed pa yang yod do //
translated: “O Vidyuddeva, there are some sentient beings who, although attached to desires, are ripening unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sems can kha cig ni 'dod pa'i yul la reg pa tsam mam /
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni 'dod pa'i yul la reg pa tsam mam /
translated: Some sentient beings, merely by touching an object of desire,

original: 'dod pa'i sems kyis tshig smras pa tsam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su smin par byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sems kyis tshig smras pa tsam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su smin par byed pa yang yod do //
translated: or merely by speaking with a desirous mind, bring to maturity unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sems can kha cig ni gzugs sdug gu dag mthong nas /
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni gzugs sdug gu dag mthong nas /
translated: Some sentient beings, seeing beautiful forms,🔽give rise to a desirous mind.

original: 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa las gzugs de rnam par 'gyur zhing zhig par mthong ba nyid kyis gzugs mi rtag par khong du chud par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa las gzugs de rnam par 'gyur zhing zhig par mthong ba nyid kyis gzugs mi rtag par khong du chud par gyur nas /
translated: But then, seeing that form change and disintegrate, they understand that form is impermanent.

original: 'dod pa'i gdung ba nye bar zhi ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gdung ba nye bar zhi ste /
translated: The torment of desire is pacified,🔽and by bringing to mind the impermanence of form, they bring to maturity unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mi rtag pa nyid shin tu yid la byed pa nyid kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su smin par byed pa yang yod do; ;sems can kha cig ni bud med mthong ba na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid shin tu yid la byed pa nyid kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su smin par byed pa yang yod do; ;sems can kha cig ni bud med mthong ba na /
translated: Some sentient beings, when they see a woman,

original: mngon par zhen pa skyes pa med kyang /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa skyes pa med kyang /
translated: do not give rise to attachment.

original: phyis yid la dran pa'i dbang gis 'dod chags kyi sems skyes nas /
analyzed: phyis yid la dran pa'i dbang gis 'dod chags kyi sems skyes nas /
translated: But later, by the power of remembering her, a desirous mind arises.

original: de'i kha dog dang dbyibs yid la byas nas rjes su chags pa skye bar 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: de'i kha dog dang dbyibs yid la byas nas rjes su chags pa skye bar 'gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: Some, by bringing to mind the color and shape of a woman, give rise to attachment.

original: sems can kha cig ni rmi lam na gzugs yid du 'ong ba dag mthong ba'i dbang gis 'dod chags kyi mngon par zhen pa @55a *//
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni rmi lam na gzugs yid du 'ong ba dag mthong ba'i dbang gis 'dod chags kyi mngon par zhen pa @55a *//
translated: Some sentient beings, due to seeing pleasant forms in a dream, give rise to attachment and clinging.

original: skyes nas / yid la byed cing yongs su gnyer bar byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: skyes nas / yid la byed cing yongs su gnyer bar byed pa yang yod do //
translated: They bring that to mind and pursue it.

original: sems can kha cig ni bud med kyi sgra thos pa tsam gyis 'dod chags kyi sred pa skyed par byed la /
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni bud med kyi sgra thos pa tsam gyis 'dod chags kyi sred pa skyed par byed la /
translated: Some sentient beings give rise to craving attachment merely by hearing the sound of a woman.

original: res 'ga' ni mthong ba tsam gyis 'dod chags kyi sems dang bral nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su smin par byed pa yang yod pas /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mthong ba tsam gyis 'dod chags kyi sems dang bral nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su smin par byed pa yang yod pas /
translated: Some, merely by seeing her, give rise to a mind free from attachment and bring to maturity unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir; glog thob /
analyzed: de'i phyir; glog thob /
translated: Therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags kyi nad rnam pa sna tshogs gang yin pa dang / 'dod chags kyi sman rnam pa sna tshogs gang yin pa de dag thabs mkhas pas legs par khong du chud kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags kyi nad rnam pa sna tshogs gang yin pa dang / 'dod chags kyi sman rnam pa sna tshogs gang yin pa de dag thabs mkhas pas legs par khong du chud kyang /
translated: Bodhisattvas, with their skill in means, understand the various kinds of diseases of desire and the various kinds of medicines for desire.

original: chos kyi dbyings la gnyis su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma yang med la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la gnyis su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma yang med la /
translated: Yet, within the realm of phenomena, there are no characteristics of dualistic grasping.

original: chos kyi dbyings la rmongs par gyur pa'i sems can dag la yang snying rje chen po skyed par byed do //🔽glog thob / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ces bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes zhes bya ba'i chos cung zad tsam yang dmigs su med pas; byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag gis mthong ba ltar na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la rmongs par gyur pa'i sems can dag la yang snying rje chen po skyed par byed do // glog thob / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ces bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes zhes bya ba'i chos cung zad tsam yang dmigs su med pas; byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag gis mthong ba ltar na /
translated: They also give rise to great compassion for sentient beings who are confused about the realm of phenomena.🔽“Jyotiṣka, desire, anger, and delusion, and the wisdom of the realm of phenomena, are not even slightly observable.

original: sems can rnams ni mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni mtshan ma med pa /
translated: Bodhisattvas think, ‘As I see it, sentient beings are without characteristics.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dben pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dben pa /
translated: They are empty and void by nature.

original: btags pa tsam du rnam par bzhag pa /
analyzed: btags pa tsam du rnam par bzhag pa /
translated: They are established as mere imputations.

original: tshogs shing 'dus pa'i chos 'di la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skyed par byed pas /
analyzed: tshogs shing 'dus pa'i chos 'di la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skyed par byed pas /
translated: “These phenomena, which are a coming together and a gathering, give rise to desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: bdag gis 'di dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor @55b brtags nas /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor @55b brtags nas /
translated: Therefore, I will examine them individually, just as they are.

original: 'dod chags kyis rmongs par gyur pa'i sems can de dag gi ched du snying rje chen po la gnas nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis rmongs par gyur pa'i sems can de dag gi ched du snying rje chen po la gnas nas /
translated: For the sake of those sentient beings who are confused by desire, I will abide in great compassion

original: sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: and fulfill my previous aspirations.

original: chos kyi dbyings las ma g-yos par rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su smin par bya'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las ma g-yos par rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su smin par bya'o snyam du sems so //
translated: Without wavering from the realm of phenomena, I will ripen them with effortless wisdom.”

original: skyes pa gang zhig bud med dag la yang dag pa ma yin pas sdug pa'i 'du shes bskyed nas /
analyzed: skyes pa gang zhig bud med dag la yang dag pa ma yin pas sdug pa'i 'du shes bskyed nas /
translated: “When a man develops a false perception of a woman as attractive,

original: 'dod chags lci ba skyes par gyur na /
analyzed: 'dod chags lci ba skyes par gyur na /
translated: and desire arises in him,

original: byang chub sems dpas bud med shin tu sdug cing mdzes pa gzugs kyi mtshan khyad par du 'phags pa rin po che'i rgyan phreng dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bud med shin tu sdug cing mdzes pa gzugs kyi mtshan khyad par du 'phags pa rin po che'i rgyan phreng dang ldan pa /
translated: a bodhisattva will then manifest as a woman who is extremely attractive and beautiful, with an exceptional physical appearance and adorned with precious ornaments.

original: rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rab tu brgyan pas lha'i bu mo dang 'dra bar gyur pa /
analyzed: rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rab tu brgyan pas lha'i bu mo dang 'dra bar gyur pa /
translated: They transform into various kinds of ornaments, like divine maidens,

original: sngon ma mthong ba dag tu bsgyur nas sems can de dag gis ji ltar sred cing rjes su chags pa dang / shin tu mngon par zhen par gyur pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: sngon ma mthong ba dag tu bsgyur nas sems can de dag gis ji ltar sred cing rjes su chags pa dang / shin tu mngon par zhen par gyur pa ston par byed de /
translated: and they display themselves in ways that those beings desire, in ways that they crave and cling to.

original: de dag gi nus pa dang sbyar nas thabs kyis 'dod chags kyi dug mda' dbyung ba'i ched du rang dbang du gyur pa'i mthus bud med kyi gzugs su bsgyur nas /
analyzed: de dag gi nus pa dang sbyar nas thabs kyis 'dod chags kyi dug mda' dbyung ba'i ched du rang dbang du gyur pa'i mthus bud med kyi gzugs su bsgyur nas /
translated: In accordance with their abilities, they use skillful means to extract the poisoned arrow of desire.🔽They transform into the form of a woman, appear before them, and teach the Dharma.

original: de'i mdun du snang bar byas nas chos bstan pa nyid kyis sems can de dag chos kyi dbyings rtogs par byas te mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mdun du snang bar byas nas chos bstan pa nyid kyis sems can de dag chos kyi dbyings rtogs par byas te mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They cause those beings to realize the realm of phenomena and then disappear.

original: bud med gang zhig skyes pa dag la 'dod chags kyi sems skyes par gyur na /
analyzed: bud med gang zhig skyes pa dag la 'dod chags kyi sems skyes par gyur na /
translated: If a woman gives rise to desire for a man,

original: byang chub sems dpas skyes pa'i lus bstan nas 'dod chags kyi dug mda' dbyung ba'i ched du chos bstan pa nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings la zhugs par byas nas mi snang bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas skyes pa'i lus bstan nas 'dod chags kyi dug mda' dbyung ba'i ched du chos bstan pa nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings la zhugs par byas nas mi snang bar byed do //
translated: The bodhisattvas manifest a male body in order to extract the poison arrow of desire and, by teaching the Dharma, they cause them to enter the realm of phenomena and then disappear.

original: glog @56a *// thob; 'dod chags kyi spyod pa nyi khri chig stong dang / spyod pa gzhan de dag kyang gtogs par brgyad khri bzhi stong du gyur pa de dag byang chub sems dpas rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi sgo mo bye ba stong phrag tshad med pa bskyed de /
analyzed: glog @56a *// thob; 'dod chags kyi spyod pa nyi khri chig stong dang / spyod pa gzhan de dag kyang gtogs par brgyad khri bzhi stong du gyur pa de dag byang chub sems dpas rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi sgo mo bye ba stong phrag tshad med pa bskyed de /
translated: Vidyuddeva, there are twenty-one thousand practices of desire and, including the other practices, there are eighty-four thousand. The bodhisattvas, with effortless wisdom, give rise to countless thousands of millions of Dharma doors.

original: sems can rnams kyi sems khong du chud par byas nas thams cad rnam par grol bar gyur kyang bdag gis sems can la 'di lta bu'i chos bstan to snyam du sems pa yang med la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems khong du chud par byas nas thams cad rnam par grol bar gyur kyang bdag gis sems can la 'di lta bu'i chos bstan to snyam du sems pa yang med la /
translated: They understand the minds of beings and liberate them all, yet they do not think, ‘I have taught the Dharma to beings like this.’

original: sems can rnam par grol bar gyur pa yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can rnam par grol bar gyur pa yang mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not observe that beings have been liberated.

original: glog thob / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: glog thob / 'di lta ste /
translated: Vidyuddeva, it is like this:

original: dper na / mtsho ma dros pa'i klu'i rgyal po ni las kyi mthu'i dbang gis de'i pho brang gi nang nas chu klung chen po bzhi byung nas sems can chu dang / skam la gnas pa dag dbyar tsha ba'i dus kyi tshe bsil ba dang /
analyzed: dper na / mtsho ma dros pa'i klu'i rgyal po ni las kyi mthu'i dbang gis de'i pho brang gi nang nas chu klung chen po bzhi byung nas sems can chu dang / skam la gnas pa dag dbyar tsha ba'i dus kyi tshe bsil ba dang /
translated: For example, the power of the karma of the nāga king of Lake Anavatapta causes four great rivers to flow from his palace, and he makes many sentient beings very happy by cooling those sentient beings who live in the water and on dry land during the hot season.

original: rlan gyis me tog dang 'bras bu dag rgyas shing 'bru rnams 'phel bar gyur nas sems can mang po shin tu bde bar byed kyang /
analyzed: rlan gyis me tog dang 'bras bu dag rgyas shing 'bru rnams 'phel bar gyur nas sems can mang po shin tu bde bar byed kyang /
translated: His flowers and fruits flourish and his crops increase.

original: klu'i rgyal po de bdag gis chu klung bzhi po 'di dag phyung ngo //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po de bdag gis chu klung bzhi po 'di dag phyung ngo //
translated: The nāga king does not think, “I have produced these four rivers,”

original: dbyung bar bya'o snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
analyzed: dbyung bar bya'o snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
translated: “I will produce them.”🔽Nevertheless, the four rivers always flow and he benefits sentient beings.

original: 'on kyang chu klung bzhi po dag rtag tu 'bab cing sems can rnams nye bar spyod par byed do; ;byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin du sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i dbang gis rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa
analyzed: 'on kyang chu klung bzhi po dag rtag tu 'bab cing sems can rnams nye bar spyod par byed do; ;byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin du sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i dbang gis rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva, by the power of the perfection of his former prayers, with effortless knowledge, teaches the four noble truths to sentient beings with the four kinds of perfect confidence.

original: bzhi bstan @56b nas 'khor ba'i yongs su gdung pa thams cad bsal te /
analyzed: bzhi bstan @56b nas 'khor ba'i yongs su gdung pa thams cad bsal te /

analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa mchog tu skyes pa tshal der 'khor mang po brgya stong tshad med pas yongs su bskor ba dag la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta ste /
translated: At that time, the Thus-Gone Supremely Born was in that forest, surrounded by an immeasurable assembly of hundreds of thousands. He taught this Dharma discourse on dependent origination:

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /

analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /🔽sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: Conditioned by becoming, birth comes to be.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The condition of birth gives rise to aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife.🔽“Thus, all these dependently arisen phenomena are nothing but a great mass of suffering.”

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di dag thams cad ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig go zhes rgya cher rnam par phye ste ston par mdzad pas; glog thob /

analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di la ma rig pa yang 'du byed la mi sems mi rtog la /

original: 'du byed kyang ma rig pa la mi sems mi rtog go /
analyzed: 'du byed kyang ma rig pa la mi sems mi rtog go /

original: de bzhin du skye ba yang rga shi la mi sems mi rtog pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba yang rga shi la mi sems mi rtog pas /

analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dmigs su med pas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are by nature unobservable, unconditioned,

original: dran pa med pa /🔽bdag dang bdag gi med pa /
analyzed: dran pa med pa / bdag dang bdag gi med pa /
translated: without mindfulness,🔽without self or entities connected to a self,

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam @70b par dag pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam @70b par dag pa /

original: phan tshun gcig gis gcig mi rig pa yin no //

analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams 'di lta bu'i chos ma thob pa'i phyir gzugs ni bdag yin no // bdag ni gzugs rnams dang ldan no //
translated: Because ordinary people have not attained this kind of Dharma, they grasp at form as the self,🔽the self as possessing form,

original: gzugs ni bdag gi yin no zhes 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag gi yin no zhes 'dzin par byed do //
translated: and form as belonging to the self.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar la yang de bzhin no //

analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin par byed /
translated: Due to the power of clinging to the self and what belongs to the self, they grasp the impermanent as permanent,

original: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'dzin par byed /

analyzed: phyin ci log tu lta ba'i phyir ma rig pas rmongs nas yang dag par tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed cing /
translated: Because of inverted views, they are deluded by ignorance and do not properly and correctly attend to

analyzed: bdag dang; gang zag dang / sems can zhes bya ba nas srog ces bya ba'i bar du cung zad tsam yang yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
translated: They do not see even the slightest existence of a self, a person, a sentient being, or a life force.

analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / gsod ba dang / gnod par byed pa dag kyang mi dmigs so zhes gsungs pa dang / glog thob /
translated: They do not observe birth, aging, sickness, death, killing, or harming.

analyzed: de'i tshe bshan pa 'jigs su rung bas rgyang nas /
translated: At that time, a terrifying butcher heard from afar

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos bshad pa'i sgra thos nas @71a *//
translated: the Thus-Gone One teaching the Dharma.

analyzed: go bar gyur pas de ma thag tu gsod pa'i sems nye bar zhi bar gyur nas /
translated: Understanding this, he immediately calmed his murderous thoughts.

original: mtshon cha spangs te g-yang sa nas byung nas /
analyzed: mtshon cha spangs te g-yang sa nas byung nas /

original: bcom ldan 'das de ga la ba der song ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ga la ba der song ste /
translated: He went to where the Blessed One was,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said to the Blessed One,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽today I will go forth in the teachings of the Thus-Gone One and practice the path.”

analyzed: bdag ni deng de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas lam bsgrub par 'tshal lo zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de rigs so //
analyzed: de rigs so //
translated: “Excellent!

analyzed: dge slong legs par 'ongs sam zhes gsungs ma thag tu dge slong gi dngos por gyur nas bsnyen par rdzogs par gyur to //
translated: Welcome, monk!” As soon as he said this, the man became a monk and was fully ordained.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa mchog tu skyes pas de'i lhag pa'i bsam pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas mthar gyis yongs su smin par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa mchog tu skyes pas de'i lhag pa'i bsam pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas mthar gyis yongs su smin par mdzad nas /
translated: Then the Tathāgata Uttamajāta, knowing his superior intention, gradually ripened him.

translated: When he heard the extensive teaching of the bodhisattva deeds, he attained irreversibility in the Buddha’s teaching.

translated: That elephant, having heard the Tathāgata’s very refined speech teaching the Dharma of dependent origination, gave rise to great joy in his mind.

analyzed: shi 'phos pa'i 'og tu dga' ldan gyi lha'i gnas su skyes nas tha mar byams pa dang phrad de /

analyzed: yang dag pa'i dad pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: He became endowed with right faith.

analyzed: glog thob / @71b de ltar na sems can rnams kyi spyod pa ni shin tu zab pa dang / rnam par rig par dka' zhing shes par dka' ba yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir / glog thob /
translated: Therefore, O Kauśika,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su gnyer bar 'dod pas /
translated: a bodhisattva who wishes to strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

translated: should become very skilled in the faculties and conduct of sentient beings, and then abide in an attitude of equality toward all sentient beings, in an attitude free of obstruction, and should always be free of attachment to all phenomena.

analyzed: ci 'dod pa rnams yongs su spangs te tshul khrims rnam par dag pa bsgrub par bya'o //

original: brtson 'grus bskyed par bya'o //

analyzed: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should be equipoised in concentration and meditative absorption.

analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la so sor brtag par bya'o //

analyzed: glog thob / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi gter gang zhe na /
translated: Aṣṭamaka, what is the Dharma treasure of the bodhisattvas?

translated: It is like this:

original: 'di lta ste; don dam pa gang yin pa'o //

original: don dam pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes la 'di lta bu dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //

translated: The correct understanding of the Dharma is the correct understanding of the Dharma as it is, through the correct analysis of the phenomena of form.

translated: “The discernment of eloquence” means that, although bodhisattvas teach the phenomena of form in a way that is suited to the faculties of sentient beings, they are free from defilement and do not cling to anything.🔽“The discernment of phenomena” means that, because bodhisattvas possess this kind of wisdom, they teach the Dharma to all sentient beings who are confused and cling to the phenomena of form.

translated: This is called the Dharma treasure of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis gter 'di thob par gyur na spyod yul rnams la rmongs par gyur pa'i sems can de lta bu dag yongs su gdul bar 'dod pa'i phyir /🔽de dag gi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du de dag re re la yang bskal pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis gter 'di thob par gyur na spyod yul rnams la rmongs par gyur pa'i sems can de lta bu dag yongs su gdul bar 'dod pa'i phyir / de dag gi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du de dag re re la yang bskal pa'am /
translated: When a bodhisattva obtains this treasure, in order to guide those beings who are confused about their sphere of activity,

original: bskal pa las lhag par tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyi thabs la mkhas pas chos ston par byed kyang de dag gi mtha' yang rnyed par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag par tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyi thabs la mkhas pas chos ston par byed kyang de dag gi mtha' yang rnyed par mi 'gyur la /
translated: in accordance with their aspirations, he teaches the Dharma to each of them for an eon or more than an eon, using various methods and expressions, but he does not find their end.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab la yang 'grib pa med cing chos kyi dbyings dang mi 'gal bar gnyis su med cing dbyer med pa'i rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab la yang 'grib pa med cing chos kyi dbyings dang mi 'gal bar gnyis su med cing dbyer med pa'i rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: And the wisdom of that bodhisattva does not diminish, and it is not in conflict with the realm of phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas chos thams @73a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas chos thams @73a *//
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s skill in means with regard to all phenomena.

original: cad dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pas 'thob pa'i chos kyi gter zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cad dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pas 'thob pa'i chos kyi gter zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the treasure of the Dharma that is attained through the teaching of the characteristic of the inseparability of all phenomena.

original: chos kyi gter 'dis sems can dag la ci rigs par chos bstan nas zad mi shes pa'i chos kyi gter phun sum tshogs par gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi gter 'dis sems can dag la ci rigs par chos bstan nas zad mi shes pa'i chos kyi gter phun sum tshogs par gyur te /
translated: Through this treasure of the Dharma, the bodhisattvas teach the Dharma to sentient beings in accordance with their dispositions and become endowed with the inexhaustible treasure of the Dharma.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyud pa gtan du spong ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyud pa gtan du spong ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: This is the abandonment of the continuum of saṃsāra forever.

original: glog thob / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gter chen po dang / zad mi shes pa'i gter dang / kun tu zad mi shes pa'i gter dang / mtha' med pa'i gter rnam pa lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: glog thob / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gter chen po dang / zad mi shes pa'i gter dang / kun tu zad mi shes pa'i gter dang / mtha' med pa'i gter rnam pa lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the five kinds of great treasure, inexhaustible treasure, inexhaustible treasure in every respect, and limitless treasure of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gter 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur na yong tan khyad par du 'phags pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshegs chung dus myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gter 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur na yong tan khyad par du 'phags pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshegs chung dus myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
translated: When a bodhisattva becomes endowed with such a treasure, he quickly and with little difficulty attains the perfection of the special qualities and manifests unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will be extensive.

original: chos kyi gter bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' glog thob ni gzungs rab tu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: chos kyi gter bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' glog thob ni gzungs rab tu thob par gyur to //
translated: When this Dharma discourse, the teaching of the Dharma treasure, was taught, the bodhisattva O Vajra obtained retention.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya ni glog gi 'od zer zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya ni glog gi 'od zer zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur to //
translated: Five hundred bodhisattvas obtained the absorption called “lightning radiance.”

original: lha'i bu sum khri drug stong ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
analyzed: lha'i bu sum khri drug stong ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
translated: Thirty-six thousand gods gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' zla ba'i rgyal mtshan gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' zla ba'i rgyal mtshan gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Candradhvaja asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du rtsol ba ma mchis pa'i ye @73b shes zhes gang gsungs pa de'i don ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du rtsol ba ma mchis pa'i ye @73b shes zhes gang gsungs pa de'i don ji lta bu lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the meaning of what you have said about the knowledge that is without effort?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' bstsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' bstsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Son of noble family, the knowledge that is without effort is the knowledge that is without conceptualization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis dge ba'i chos rnams la lus dang sems kyi rjes su mthun par dmigs shing mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa de ni rtsol ba dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis dge ba'i chos rnams la lus dang sems kyi rjes su mthun par dmigs shing mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa de ni rtsol ba dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who observes and engages in virtuous dharmas with body and mind is said to be “with effort.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang lus dang sems rab tu dul bar gyur nas dran pa med pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang lus dang sems rab tu dul bar gyur nas dran pa med pa /
translated: The bodhisattva who, having well subdued body and mind, is without mindfulness,

original: gnas pa med pa; rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i mtshan ma dang bral bar gyur pa dang / de sngon gyi smon lam dang ye shes yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba stong phrag mang po rnams su rnam pa sna tshogs su ston par byed kyang chos kyi dbyings las g-yo ba med pa dang /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa; rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i mtshan ma dang bral bar gyur pa dang / de sngon gyi smon lam dang ye shes yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba stong phrag mang po rnams su rnam pa sna tshogs su ston par byed kyang chos kyi dbyings las g-yo ba med pa dang /
translated: without abiding, free from the signs of cultivated yoga, and who, by fulfilling his former aspirations and wisdom, manifests in many thousands of millions of buddha-fields without moving from the dharma-element,

original: rtag tu chos ston par byed kyang chos kyi mtshan ma cung zad tsam yang med pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can yongs su smin par byed kyang sems can gang yang yongs su bzlas pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su sbyangs kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang /
analyzed: rtag tu chos ston par byed kyang chos kyi mtshan ma cung zad tsam yang med pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can yongs su smin par byed kyang sems can gang yang yongs su bzlas pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su sbyangs kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang /
translated: They constantly teach the Dharma, yet there is not the slightest trace of Dharma. They bring sentient beings to full maturity through the four ways of attracting beings, yet they do not consider any sentient beings to have been brought to full maturity. They refine all the buddhafields, yet they do not consider any buddhafield to be refined.

original: rtag par sangs rgyas rnams rjes su dran par byed kyang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid du mi lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun tu rgyu bar byed kyang chos kyi dbyings dang mi 'bral gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag par sangs rgyas rnams rjes su dran par byed kyang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid du mi lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun tu rgyu bar byed kyang chos kyi dbyings dang mi 'bral gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: They constantly keep the Buddhas in mind, yet they do not see them in terms of physical characteristics. They move around in all the buddhafields, yet they are never separated from the expanse of reality.🔽This is called the bodhisattvas’ effortless gnosis.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'di lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir @74a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'di lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir @74a *//
translated: Because bodhisattvas possess this kind of gnosis,

original: sems can thams cad kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang gang byas pa de dag la yang mngon par zhen pa yang med do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang gang byas pa de dag la yang mngon par zhen pa yang med do //
translated: He fulfills the hopes of all sentient beings, but he does not cling to anything he has done.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes 'di bstan pa na stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes 'di bstan pa na stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur to //
translated: At that time, when the Blessed One taught this effortless wisdom, this trichiliocosm shook in six ways.

original: brgya byin lha'i dbang po yang sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams dang bcas te steng gi bar snang las me tog man da rab ba dang / autpa la dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dang / pun da ri ka dang / tsan dan gyi phye ma'i char mngon par phab ste /
analyzed: brgya byin lha'i dbang po yang sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams dang bcas te steng gi bar snang las me tog man da rab ba dang / autpa la dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dang / pun da ri ka dang / tsan dan gyi phye ma'i char mngon par phab ste /
translated: Śakra, lord of the gods, together with the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, rained down a shower of mandārava flowers, blue lotuses, kumutas, lotuses, punnāgas, and sandalwood powder from the sky above.

original: bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
translated: They praised the Blessed One.

original: lha'i rnga rnams kyang rang sgra byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: lha'i rnga rnams kyang rang sgra byung bar gyur to //
translated: The gods’ drums sounded by themselves.

original: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i snang ba chen pos kyang kun tu snang bar byas te /
analyzed: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i snang ba chen pos kyang kun tu snang bar byas te /
translated: A great, wondrous, and marvelous light shone everywhere.

original: sems can gang la reg par gyur pa de'i lus kyang shin tu bsil bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems can gang la reg par gyur pa de'i lus kyang shin tu bsil bar gyur to //
translated: And the bodies of those sentient beings who came into contact with it became cool.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' glog thob la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' glog thob la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Vidyud-deva:

original: glog thob / 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang gnas 'dir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu gsungs so //
analyzed: glog thob / 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang gnas 'dir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu gsungs so //
translated: Vidyud-deva, in this place the past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones also taught this kind of Dharma discourse.

original: ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du byung ba'i tshe yang gnas 'dir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu gsungs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du byung ba'i tshe yang gnas 'dir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu gsungs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the future Tathāgatas appear in the world, they will also teach this kind of Dharma discourse in this place.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams @74b tshad med grangs med pa dag na da ltar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang chos kyi rnam grangs 'di rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad pa'i phyir 'od zer chen po 'gyed par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams @74b tshad med grangs med pa dag na da ltar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang chos kyi rnam grangs 'di rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad pa'i phyir 'od zer chen po 'gyed par mdzad do //
translated: The Tathāgatas who are presently dwelling in countless, limitless world systems emit great light rays in order to continuously perform this kind of Dharma discourse.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te bla gos phrag ba gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te bla gos phrag ba gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la bde logs su thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la bde logs su thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: With his palms together he bowed toward the Blessed One and asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: what is the name of this Dharma discourse?

original: bdag gis ji ltar yongs su gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: bdag gis ji ltar yongs su gzung bar bgyi /
translated: How should I remember it?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni mi zad pa'i gter bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni mi zad pa'i gter bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this Dharma discourse is called The Teaching of the Inexhaustible Treasure.

original: chos thams cad dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is also called The Teaching of the Inseparable Characteristics of All Phenomena.

original: khyod kyis de ltar yang ming yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar yang ming yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: You should remember it by those names.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken,

original: byang chub sems dpa' glog thob dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang / 'khor bzhi po rnams dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la yi rangs te mngon par bstod do ////🔽'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las /🔽mi zad pa'i gter bstan pa'i le'u zhes @75a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' glog thob dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang / 'khor bzhi po rnams dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la yi rangs te mngon par bstod do //// 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / mi zad pa'i gter bstan pa'i le'u zhes @75a *//
translated: the bodhisattva Vidyunnivāsin, the venerable Ānanda, the four assemblies, and the entire world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One's teaching.🔽This concludes the chapter on the inexhaustible treasure,

original: bya ba ste 'dus pa nyi shu ba rdzogs so //
analyzed: bya ba ste 'dus pa nyi shu ba rdzogs so //
translated: the twenty-first chapter in the Dharma discourse of the Great Heap of Jewels.
